title: Name clashes in interface implementation
body:
by **mail@duncanpearson.net**: 
There does not appear to be a way for a struct to implement two different
interfaces that share a common function name. Even if the function has the
same signature in each interface the intended functionality might be
different. At worst the signatures might be different and so implementing
both would be impossible.

A mechanism that declared an implementation through a map of interface
names to implementation names would seem to work.
